Package com.foreach.across.modules.entity.config.builders

Class EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<T extends EntityViewProcessor>

java.lang.Object
com.foreach.across.modules.entity.config.builders.EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<T>
public class EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<T extends EntityViewProcessor> extends Object
Represents a single EntityViewProcessor registration record.
Since:
4.0.0
Author:
Arne Vandamme

  • Method Details

    • deferred

      public EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<T> deferred()
      Should this configurer be applied as a postprocessor, after all the initial registration of processor has been done.

      Default is false, but set to true if you want to modify/remove view processors that have been previously added.

      Returns:
      current configurer

    • beanFactory

      public EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<T> beanFactory(@NonNull @NonNull org.springframework.beans.factory.config.AutowireCapableBeanFactory beanFactory)
      Specify the bean factory that should be used for all calls of getBean, createBean and provider. Usually an instance is pre-configured with an appropriate bean factory but developers can override the one to use.
      Parameters:
      beanFactory - to use
      Returns:
      current configurer

    • skipIfPresent

      public EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<T> skipIfPresent()
      Simply skip this configurer when attempting to register a new processor which is already present. By default an exception would be thrown (unless updateIfPresent() is set).

      Mutually exclusive with replaceIfPresent() and updateIfPresent().

      Returns:
      current configurer

    • updateIfPresent

      public EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<T> updateIfPresent()
      Update the existing processor when attempting to register a new processor which is already present. This will only apply order and configure rules, but will throw an exception if the existing processor is of a different type an skipIfDifferentType() is not set.

      Mutually exclusive with replaceIfPresent() and skipIfPresent().

      Returns:
      current configurer

    • replaceIfPresent

      public EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<T> replaceIfPresent()
      Replace any existing processor when attempting to register a new processor which is already present. This will do an in-place replacement, keeping the previously set order unless it is specified on this configurer. A combination of remove() and adding a new processor would always add the processor with the default order.

      Mutually exclusive with updateIfPresent() and skipIfPresent().

      Returns:
      current configurer

    • skipIfDifferentType

      public EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<T> skipIfDifferentType()
      Skip this configurer when it would attempt to update a processor which is not of the expected type. If not set, an exception would be thrown instead.
      Returns:
      current configurer

    • skipIfMissing

      public EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<T> skipIfMissing()
      Skip this configurer when it would attempt to update a processor which is not present. If not set, an exception would be thrown instead.
      Returns:
      current configurer

    • withType

      public <Y extends EntityViewProcessor> EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<Y> withType(@NonNull @NonNull Class<Y> viewProcessorType)
      Configure the view processor with the specified type. This will determine the auto-generated name (matching the fully qualified class name).

      If withName(String) has been configured as well, the type will only be used for typing the configuration consumers.

      Type Parameters:
      Y - class parameter
      Parameters:
      viewProcessorType - type of the processor
      Returns:
      current configurer - typed to the processor type

    • withName

      public EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<T> withName(@NonNull @NonNull String viewProcessorName)
      Configure the name of this view processor. Name must be unique within the entire view processor registry.

      If not set the name will be resolved from one of the type related parameters.

      Parameters:
      viewProcessorName - name of the view processor
      Returns:
      current configurer

    • getBean

      public EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<T> getBean(@NonNull @NonNull String beanName)
      Register a new processor which is an instance of the bean with the given name. The AutowireCapableBeanFactory must have a bean definition under that name. If withName(String) has not been called, the beanName will be used as the processor name.
      Parameters:
      beanName - name of the bean definition that represents the processor
      Returns:
      current configurer

    • getBean

      public <Y extends EntityViewProcessor> EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<Y> getBean(@NonNull @NonNull Class<Y> viewProcessorType)
      Register a new processor which is an instance of the bean with the given type. Uses BeanFactory.getBean(Class) to ge the processor, a bean definition for that type must be known and depending on that bean definition a singleton or otherwise scoped instance might be returned.

      See createBean(Class) if you always want to create a new instance of a type which is possibly not registered as a bean

      Type Parameters:
      Y - class parameter
      Parameters:
      viewProcessorType - type of the processor
      Returns:
      current configurer - typed to the processor type

    • createBean

      public <Y extends EntityViewProcessor> EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<Y> createBean(@NonNull @NonNull Class<Y> viewProcessorType)
      Register a new processor which is an instance of the bean with the given type.
      Type Parameters:
      Y - class parameter
      Parameters:
      viewProcessorType - type of the processor
      Returns:
      current configurer - typed to the processor type

    • provideBean

      public <Y extends EntityViewProcessor> EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<Y> provideBean(@NonNull Y viewProcessor)
      Register the given processor.
      Type Parameters:
      Y - type
      Parameters:
      viewProcessor - processor to register
      Returns:
      current configurer - typed to the processor instance

    • provider

      public EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<T> provider(@NonNull @NonNull Function<org.springframework.beans.factory.config.AutowireCapableBeanFactory,? extends T> provider)
      Register a new processor which will be provided by applying the function on the AutowireCapableBeanFactory.
      Parameters:
      provider - that supplies the processor
      Returns:
      current configurer

    • order

      public EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<T> order(int order)
      Assign the following order to the processor.
      Parameters:
      order - to assign
      Returns:
      current configurer

    • configure

      public EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<T> configure(@NonNull @NonNull Consumer<? extends T> consumer)
      Add a configuration consumer to apply to the actual processor entry.
      Parameters:
      consumer - to apply to the processor
      Returns:
      current configurer

    • remove

      public EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<T> remove()
      Remove the processor. If the defined processor is not present, nothing will happen. If a creation is also configured, any existing processor will be removed first, and then added with the new configuration.
      Returns:
      current configurer
